flawed_nl_solution:
If he gathers for 2 hours, the number of minutes gathering is 2 * 60 minutes per hour = <<2*60=120>>120 minutes of gathering flowers
Gathering for 120 minutes / 10 minutes per flower = <<120/10=21>>21 flowers gathered
If he gathers 21 flowers initially but lost 3, he has 21-3 = <<21-3=18>>18 flowers gathered and kept
Since he has 30 classmates total and has 18 flowers, he needs to gather 30-18=<<30-18=12>>12 more flowers
Assuming it takes 10 minutes per flower, it will take him 10 * 12 = <<10*12=120>>120 minutes to gather the remaining 12 flowers needed
#### 120

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 12, not 21. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
